modName: TERA Weapons Collection for Skyrim - Leveled List
summary: Leveled list which will allow NPCs to carry and drop Weapons from the mod: TERA Weapons Collection for Skyrim - made by Iromizu.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][u][b]Description:
[/b][/u][/size]
It's been a while since I started to use the mod: [b]TERA Weapons Collection for Skyrim[/b] by Iromizu (

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27463/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27463/?[/url] )

Although the Weapons are non-lore friendly, the designs are amazing, so I couldn't resist it.
The only thing missing, was a leveled list, so the equipments could be found all over Skyrim.
The mod is long long abandoned as the creator was banned, so I decided to look for alternatives.

There is a Leveled list made here: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37676/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37676/?[/url]
But I couldn't be satisfied with Level-10 enemies walking around with Draedric armors, so I decided to spend some time learning how to make a leveled list via CK.

It has a small progression curve, so, some of them would only be able to be found on higher levels.
So, here it is: You should be able to find Tera Weapons being held by bandits, soldiers, in some chests, and sold by Merchants and Blacksmiths, all on a fairly rare rate.

[size=4][u][b]Requirements:
[/b][/u][/size]
You MUST have installed "Tera Weapons Collection v1.1" from Iromizu:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27463/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27463/?[/url]


[b]Installation:
[/b]
1) Download the file;
2) Unzip it;
3) Drop the file on your Skyrim\Data\ Folder;
[color=#ff7700]4) OVERWRITE your "TERA Weapons.esp" (make sure to have a backup first, in case you want to roll it back)[/color]
5) Run Skyrim and Have fun!

[b]Note:[/b] Maybe it's necessary to "wait" for a while so the cells can reset and update the lists.

Also, let me know if the drop rate is satisfying.
Be gentle, it's the first time I try to make a leveled list!!

[b]Note:[/b] There is no magic weapons support, I'm still learning about it and it looks like it is very very time consuming

to be done.

[u][b]Credits:[/b][/u]
[b]Bethesda[/b] for this damn amazing Game;
[b]Bethesda[/b] again, for sharing with us the resources, allowing creativity around the world to flourish. That's the business model of the future;
[b]Iromizu[/b] for his great conversion;
author: Inert-Ren
